body:
can you also do the same change in ``whatsnew/v0.16.2`` and change the test

```
pandas) bash-3.2$ grep -r sm.poisson doc/
doc//source/whatsnew/v0.16.2.txt:   # sm.poisson takes (formula, data)
doc//source/whatsnew/v0.16.2.txt:      .pipe((sm.poisson, 'data'), 'hr ~ ln_h + year + g + C(lg)')
doc//source/basics.rst:For example, we can fit a regression using statsmodels. Their API expects a formula first and a ``DataFrame`` as the second argument, ``data``. We pass in the function, keyword pair ``(sm.poisson, 'data')`` to ``pipe``:
doc//source/basics.rst:      .pipe((sm.poisson, 'data'), 'hr ~ ln_h + year + g + C(lg)')
```
